page.title: 03Skellingthorpe Village
page.content: Skellingthorpe Village dates back many centuries but today there are more modern houses. St Lawrences School, the Stones Public house and the Church are three of the oldest buildings but there are lots of old cottages and an old Village hall built in 1828. All of these are still in use today. The hall is used for all sorts of clubs including Scouts, Guides and a thrift shop. There are a lot of farms in and around Skellingthorpe including Manor and Holmes Farms. Nurses Lane is mainly modern houses while there are some old peoples bungalows on Hodsons Close. There is a very interesting post box in the village which still bears the initials of King George the Sixth.
